summary: This is an email forwarding documents related to a confidentiality order in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, including sealed opinions and protective orders. It originates from the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC and appears to be sharing public case documents.

persons.name: Stan Pottinger
persons.context: Appears as the sender/author of the email from the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC, forwarding case documents.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in the subject line as the subject of the confidentiality order and case documents being forwarded.

persons.name: Judge Sweet
persons.context: Mentioned in the email subject line in relation to the confidentiality order in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Pottinger's law firm is handling or distributing documents related to the legal case against Maxwell.
Judge Sweet is presiding over or involved in issuing orders in the case against Maxwell.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order [DE 62] was filed in the case, likely to govern the handling of sensitive information.

events.title: New Case Manager Assigned
events.description: A new case manager was assigned to the case, as indicated by docket entry [DE 56].

events.title: Sealed Opinion Filed
events.description: A sealed opinion was filed in the case, indicating confidential judicial rulings.

events.title: Email Forwarding Case Documents
events.description: Stan Pottinger forwarded case documents including sealed opinions and protective orders related to the Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The email forwards multiple legal documents including a sealed opinion from November 14, 2017, a protective order from March 18, 2016, and a notice of new case manager assignment from July 18, 2017.
The documents are described as 'public' and relate to a confidentiality order in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell presided over by Judge Sweet.
The correspondence originates from Stan Pottinger, a partner at Edwards Pottinger LLC, indicating legal professional involvement in the case.
The email shows ongoing legal proceedings and document management in the Maxwell case as of early 2019.
